Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
INVOCATION - Delivered by: Pastor Joseph Diesel Sano who serves as the spiritual leader of Iglesia de Dios de la Profecia Williamsburg located at 333 Union Avenue, Brooklyn, NY 11211.

Motion to spread the Invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Reynoso.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by Pastor Joseph Diesel Sano who serves as the spirtual leader of Iglesia de Dios de la Profecia Williamsburg located at 333 Union Avenue, Brooklyn, N.Y. 11211.

Council Member Reynoso moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: ADOPTION OF MINUTES - Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of January 23, 2020  be adopted as printed by Council Member Louis.
Items.MinutesNote: Council Member Louis moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of January 23, 2020 be adopted as printed.

Items.Title: Messages & Papers from the Mayor

Communication from the Mayor – Submitting the name of Niisha K. Butler to the City Council for advice and consent concerning her appointment to the New York City Tax Commission, pursuant to Sections 31 and 153 of the New York City Charter.
Items.ActionText: This Mayor's Message was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections
Items.MatterName: Niisha K. Butler, New York City Tax Commission

Items.Title: Communication from the Office of Management & Budget – Transfer City funds between various agencies in Fiscal Year 2020 to implement changes to the City's expense budget, pursuant to Section 107(b) of the New York City Charter (MN-3)

Items.MatterName: Transfer City funds between various agencies in FY'20 to implement changes to the City's expense budget. (MN-3)

Items.Title: Petitions and Communications
Land Use Call-Ups

By Council Member Van Bramer:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and §20-226 of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Consumer Affairs approving an unenclosed sidewalk café located at 6002 Woodside Avenue, Borough of Queens,  Council District 26, Community District 2.  Application No. 20205193 TCQ (Sean OG’s), shall be subject to review by the Council.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Zoning, Sean OG’s, Queens (20205193 TCQ)

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass and fully fund, and the Governor to sign, A.6493/S.2281, legislation that would establish eight demonstration programs throughout New York State and one coordinating center to improve the care of sickle cell disease patients and educate about sickle cell trait
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Adopted by the Committee on Health
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Cumbo) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Cumbo) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by voice vote.
Items.MatterName: Sickle Cell Awareness (A.6493/S.2281)

Items.Title: Resolution declaring June 19 of each year Sickle Cell Awareness Day in the City of New York.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Health
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Cumbo) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Cumbo) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by voice vote.
Items.MatterName: Declaring June 19 Sickle Cell Awareness Day in NYC.

Items.Title:
RESOLUTION APPROVING THE APPOINTMENT BY THE MAYOR OF NISHA AGARWAL AS A MEMBER OF THE NEW YORK CITY CONFLICTS OF INTEREST BOARD.


By Council Member Koslowitz

RESOLVED, that pursuant to § 2602 of the New York City Charter, the Council does hereby approve the appointment of Nisha Agarwal by the Mayor as a member of the New York City Conflicts of Interest Board to serve for the remainder of a six-year term that will expire on March 31, 2022.







COUPLED ON GO
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: M 217 - Nisha Agarwal, Conflicts of Interest Board

Items.MinutesNote: The Majority Leader (Council Member Cumbo) presiding as the Acting President Pro Tempore

The presence of a quorum was announced by the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Cumbo).

There were 45 Council Members marked present at this Stated Meeting.


At the time of this Stated Meeting, there was one vacant seat on the Council in the 37th District (Brooklyn)..

At this point, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Cumbo) declared that the aforementioned item was adopted and referred to the Committee on Land Use and to the appropriate Land Use Subcommittee.

The Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Cumbo) put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such motion which was decided in the affirmative by the following vote:
At this point the Speaker (Council Member Johnson) made the following annoucements:

Whereupon on motion of the Speaker (Council Member Johnson), the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Cumbo) adjourned to meet again on Wednesday, March 18, 2020.

MICHAEL McSWEENEY, City Clerk
Clerk of the Council
